data.title: Great place for kids!
data.text: Oh Wow is a blast for the kids (and adults)!  It is a must see if you're in Downtown Youngstown.  The staff is wonderful as well!

data.title: Great place for families
data.text: While visiting our grandchildren in Youngstown we needed some place inside for them to do because the weather was so bad outside. We took them to OH WOW and absolutely wore out our 3 year old grandson. There is so much for children to do and it is all hands on that they will not get bored.

data.title: Youngstown's Hidden Gem for kids.
data.text: This little interactive museum just keeps growing and is so popular with the local families.  Kids and adults both will love the displays and friendly staff.

data.title: Surprisingly Youngstown
data.text: Why not look in Youngstown for an excellent place for hands on learning for all ages!  You no longer have to travel to Pittsburg or Columbus for somewhere exciting for your family members to play and learn! OH WOW now!

data.title: Tiny but fun
data.text: Great local place to kill a few hours of boredom on a weekend. It's very small and gets crowded quickly, but there's a lot crammed in to the space. Lots of stuff to keep the kids busy, fun for the parents to watch. Seemed really clean for the amount of kids that were there when we visited. We will probably go back on another "bored" weekend. :)

data.title: Love, Love, Love this place
data.text: My kids and I go here frequently!  After our first visit we became season pass holders!  The only complaint I have is that it would be nice if sometimes the volunteers were more accessible, but otherwise, very fun, educational, and a great place to spend cold, dreary days in the fall/winter or too hot/humid days in the summer.

data.title: Small but fun
data.text: The Science Center is the best museum around Youngstown for families, however it is very small. The basement is basically empty, and the staff that works the back room were not helpful. However the upstairs has a lot of bang for its buck.

data.title: The kids had a blast.
data.text: Oh Wow is a very clean and nice place, but it is small. My kids range from 9 to 5 years old and after about an hour and a half they wanted to leave. I would also suggest going during the week because it is very hectic when it is crowded due to the small space.

data.title: Gem in Y-town
data.text: My daughter LOVES the "Wow Factory." There are endless ways to entertain here. The exhibits change regularly to keep it fresh. Everything is hands on and great for children of all ages.

data.title: Oh wow! Fun for all.
data.text: Kids  of all ages will love this museum.  It is a great place to bring your grandkids, nieces and nephews.  Let your inner child come alive and take advantage of all the adventures offered at this place. I can't say enough positive things about it.

data.title: Fun for little ones
data.text: This is a great place to take the kids for the day. You can pack a lunch if you like and stay for as long as you want.

data.title: Fun for all ages
data.text: We took our 2 1/2 year old grandson and he had a blast. Especially with the vacuum tubes the shoot balls. There were a lot of different age group activities.

data.title: fun
data.text: Great place for the kids and adults to play. So many learning expierences for everyone and so much fun. A little expensive but well worth it. Friendly staff.

data.title: wow!! is the perfect description
data.text: there is so much for the kids to do and they don't even know they are learning. favorites for most kids is the water- way in the middle of everything. and who wouldn't love to be on tv. a "real " tv setting with the weather showing on a screen and the hurricane room, etc..... too much to mention. my grandkids favorite place was the craft/demo room. the boys loved dismantling appliances.

data.title: Family fun!
data.text: We have gone several times because we live 20 minutes away from it. We had a season pass one year. It doesn't change up so that was a bit of a waste in my eyes. The children love and cry when it's time to leave. There is a water area that children get soaked at. Bring extra clothes.

data.title: Great for kids under 8
data.text:
My daughter is 2 and she had a GREAT time! If you're planning a visit, I would suggest packing a raincoat and rain boots (or a change of clothes) -- there are some fun water activities for the kids to play with and they *will* get wet (or soaked if your kid is anything like mine.) :)
There were some older kids there who seemed rude and unruly (I later realized they were all from one family, so there's that.) They were cutting in front of the smaller kids and monopolizing the play areas for long periods of time. It was fine for the first two times it happened, but then it became annoying rather quickly, ESPECIALLY since the parents of these beasts were standing close by watching it all happen and did NOTHING about it. 
I recommend this place for younger kids because any older kids would grow bored QUICKLY and therefore become rude jerks.
Parents, do your older kids a favor and take them else where... but your littles?
They'll LOVE it!

data.title: Awesome place to volunteer at!
data.text:
While the date of my visit say January 2015, I actually started volunteering back in June 2014 and have been there most of the summer. I went back to volunteering there again around Christmas after a busy semester in college and plan on volunteering there again this spring on some weekends!

I gotta tell you, bring your kids here if they're bored at home and tired of playing video games all day! A lot of neat hands-on exhibits here for ALL ages!

You can also volunteer here! Just go to their front desk and ask! Great people here!

data.title: Great for young kids!
data.text: We took our 3 kids - 2,4,7 - and they had a great time. We had fun experiencing it with them. Not terribly expensive at $40. All of the staff was very friendly and engaged with the kids. If there is one negative it's a bit small. Plan on 2 hours to do everything in the place.

data.title: OH WOW! - Aptly named
data.text: We were very pleasantly surprised by this little gem. Lots of interactive engaging working exhibits. Our grandchildren loved posing behind the desk in the "TV studio" to deliver the weather report. The music exhibits and water play spouts were also lots of fun. Other favorites were using an ATM machine, running the movies backwards and forwards in slow motion and making faces that were displayed on the large wall.

data.title: Best activity in Youngstown
data.text: While this place is small, it provides a great educational experience. I am eighteen and I love this place. The people there are so amazing and helpful. I do agree that it can get a bit boring, but watch the schedule for special programs, some of them can get kids attention for hours. If you plan to go several times, just buy a year pass, they are worth the money and it is much easier to  isit frequently. There are vending machines, but I would recommend bringing a lunch with you or going to one of the nearby restaurants. Everything is clean and messes are taken care of immediately.
